Issues.Title: Separate `stable` and `oxide` engines
Issues.Body:
This PR re-organizes some things in the codebase to make it possible to develop both our current engine and the new `oxide` in tandem.

- Splits up GitHub Actions workflows into separate CI runs for each engine
- Simplifies the scripts in our `package.json` to be more idiot-proof, instead of having to run specific scripts manually in a certain order depending on what you're trying to do to get things to work
- Reduces the node engines we're testing against to just 12 and 18 on the stable engine, and just 18 on the `oxide` engine
- Updates our `insiders` release workflows to ensure that any releases on the `insiders` tag use the stable engine, and any releases on the `oxide-insiders` tag default to using the `oxide` engine, without needing to manually set the `OXIDE` environment variable
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Separate `stable` and `oxide` engines" (#10359)

Issues.Title: Inline tests
Issues.Body:
This PR is a small cleanup PR where we inline some tests that used to require a separate HTML and/or
CSS file.

This will be relevant for future PRs related to the `oxide` engine if we want to test `stable` and
`oxide` together and if we want to make small adjustments or not.

This also means that changes to the HTML/CSS will now trigger a jest run when in watch mode.

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Inline tests" (#10362)

Issues.Title: Tailwind runs out of memory in v3.2.3+ with duplicate selectors in a layer
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.2.3 **What build tool are you using?** Gulp v2.3.0, postcss v8.4.21 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v14.21.2 **What browser are you using?** N/A **What operating system are you using?** Linux **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/brgSOna4ng **Describe your issue** Tailwind runs out of memory and crashes when I put this in one of my CSS files (I duplicate selectors to increase their specificity): ```css @layer utilities { .underline.underline { text-decoration-line: underline; } } ``` then put `
` in a HTML file,. This is what Gulp reports: ``` <--- Last few GCs ---> [2769643:0x6027f90] 2895 ms: Scavenge 718.1 (757.1) -> 718.1 (757.1) MB, 38.8 / 0.0 ms (average mu = 0.942, current mu = 0.915) allocation failure [2769643:0x6027f90] 3357 ms: Scavenge 1100.6 (1139.7) -> 1100.6 (1139.7) MB, 64.0 / 0.0 ms (average mu = 0.942, current mu = 0.915) allocation failure [2769643:0x6027f90] 4494 ms: Mark-sweep 1674.4 (1713.5) -> 627.0 (664.4) MB, 531.0 / 0.0 ms (average mu = 0.809, current mu = 0.748) allocation failure scavenge might not succeed <--- JS stacktrace ---> FATAL ERROR: invalid array length Allocation failed - JavaScript heap out of memory 1: 0xa3ac30 node::Abort() [gulp designSystem] 2: 0x970199 node::FatalError(char const*, char const*) [gulp designSystem] 3: 0xbba76e v8::Utils::ReportOOMFailure(v8::internal::Isolate*, char const*, bool) [gulp designSystem] 4: 0xbbaae7 v8::internal::V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(v8::internal::Isolate*, char const*, bool) [gulp designSystem] 5: 0xd76d05 [gulp designSystem] 6: 0xd4f535 [gulp designSystem] 7: 0xed921e [gulp designSystem] 8: 0xed936d [gulp designSystem] 9: 0x1077923 v8::internal::Runtime_GrowArrayElements(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*) [gulp designSystem] 10: 0x14491d9 [gulp designSystem] Aborted (core dumped) ``` I think it is because of https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/pull/9765, specifically [this line](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/pull/9765/files#diff-4f8fb727d1bbc6be457e1e04ca23fa941e46445bea7fbae3743d2a0debc400c5R72) - if I change line #72 in my node_modules to be `} else if (a.type === 'class' && b.type === 'pseudo' && b.value !== ':merge') {` again, Tailwind doesn't crash.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tailwind runs out of memory in v3.2.3+ with duplicate selectors in a layer " (#10355)

Issues.Title: double escape happening in attribute value selectors
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss 8.4.19

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v14.19.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Kubuntu Linux

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/sRVqoiJfLV

**Describe your issue**

in the attribute value of a attribute selector the value is being double escaped and there appears to be no way to un-escape it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "double escape happening in attribute value selectors" (#10353)

Issues.Title: ^= attribute selector doesn't appear to work
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss-cli 8.3.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v14.x

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Kubuntu Linux

**Reproduction URL**


[play.tailwindcss.com/vKAEzUlXTv](https://play.tailwindcss.com/vKAEzUlXTv)

**Describe your issue**

trying to make links red in development when they don't start with http(s) but it appears the attribute selector doesn't work in this scenario. I've tried all other attribute selectors, and they seem to work

it would appear this is a bug in tailwind
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "^= attribute selector doesn't appear to work" (#10351)

Issues.Title: Custom theme/extend/screens with "/" in name not working, e.g. "ar-3/4"
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
3.2.4
**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
postcss: 8.4.20
**What version of Node.js are you using?**
18.12.1
**What browser are you using?**
Safari (latest)
Chrome (latest)
**What operating system are you using?**
MacOS
**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/gMqETne4se
**Describe your issue**
When I create custom @media query rule using theme/extend/screens and include "/" in class name, that rule is not working.
For reference I swapped "/" with "_" in reproduction URL to show that this rule is working correctly.

I need "/" to create rules for aspect ratio, e.g. "ar-16/9".
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom theme/extend/screens with "/" in name not working, e.g. "ar-3/4"" (#10327)

Issues.Title: Allow variants with slashes in the name
Issues.Body: Fixes #10327

Issues.Title: Tailwind not compiled in docker on local (dev)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss 8.4.18, Next.js 13.1.2

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v14.18.2

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Safari, Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

MacOS, Ubuntu-20.0.4 (on WSL)

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/aandriamanga/nextjs-tailwindcss-docker

**Describe your issue**

My tailwindcss not compiled when I run ¬´¬†yarn dev¬†¬ª from docker.
For reproducing this there is differents steps:
- Run `yarn install`
- Run Docker Desktop app
- Run `docker network create my_network`
- Run `docker-compose build`
- Run `docker-compose up`
- Open browser on localhost:3000
- No style is applied

When I run it outside docker, tailwind css is compiled.
For reproducing this there is differents steps:
- Run `yarn dev`
- Open browser on localhost:3000
- The styles are applied

So, I think the issue is between docker and tailwind but maybe not with nextjs.

Thank you in advance for your investigation / help
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind not compiled in docker on local (dev)" (#10326)

Issues.Title: Breakpoints inside <Style> breaking sveltekit app with "Semicolon or block is expected"
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

"tailwindcss": "^3.2.4",

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

: postcss 8.4.21, @sveltejs/kit: 1.0.0, vite 4.0.0,

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

 v18.9.0

**What browser are you using?**

For example: Chrome, Opera

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: Linux Ubuntu

**Reproduction URL**

https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltejs-kit-template-default-fsnfkn?file=src/routes/+layout.svelte


**Describe your issue**

Whenever a breakpoint responsiveness like sm:text-red-500 lg:text-blue-500 is used with @apply, [ Semicolon or block is expected ] error is thrown.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Breakpoints inside <Style> breaking sveltekit app with "Semicolon or block is expected"" (#10329)

Issues.Title: SCSS not compiled correctly to CSS
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

tailwindcss v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

I am using the standalone tailinwindcss for linux tailwindcss-linux-x64 - https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/releases/download/v3.2.4/tailwindcss-linux-x64

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

NA

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome - but the bug is not related to the browser

**What operating system are you using?**

Centos

**Reproduction URL**

NA

**Describe your issue**

these are my config files:

tailwind.config.js

```
const defaultTheme = require('tailwindcss/defaultTheme')

module.exports = {
  content: [
  './assets/v1/scss/*.{scss,css}',
  './assets/v1/css/*.{scss,css}',
  './assets/v1/js/*.js',
  './custom/classes/*.php',
  './fraemwork/*/*.php',
  './templates/v1/**/*.{js,php,scss,css}',
  ],
        darkMode: 'media', // or 'media' or 'class'
        corePlugins: {
          divideOpacity: false,
          backgroundOpacity: false,
          borderOpacity: false,
          placeholderOpacity: false,
          textOpacity: false,
        }
      }
```


postcss.config.js

```
module.exports = {
  plugins: {
    "tailwindcss": {},
    "autoprefixer": {}
  }
}
```


this is how I am running it:

`/tailwindcss  --watch -i assets/v1/scss/global.scss -o assets/v1/dist/output.css --postcss`

the file global.scss contains:

```
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

$len: 242.776657104492px;
$time: 1.6s;
.outline-style {
  stroke-dasharray: $len*0.01, $len;
  stroke-dashoffset: 0;
  animation: anim $time linear infinite;
}
@keyframes anim {
  12.5% {
    stroke-dasharray: $len*0.14, $len;
    stroke-dashoffset: -$len*0.11;
  }
  43.75% {
    stroke-dasharray: $len*0.35, $len;
    stroke-dashoffset: -$len*0.35;
  }
  100% {
    stroke-dasharray: $len*0.01, $len;
    stroke-dashoffset: -$len*0.99;
  }
}
```

the output `output.css` is  bellow. I have trimmed some styles which are not relevant and I am just keeping where I think the bug is:


```
....

$len: 242.776657104492px;

$time: 1.6s;

.outline-style {
  stroke-dasharray: $len*0.01, $len;
  stroke-dashoffset: 0;
  animation: anim $time linear infinite;
}

@keyframes anim {
  12.5% {
    stroke-dasharray: $len*0.14, $len;
    stroke-dashoffset: -$len*0.11;
  }

  43.75% {
    stroke-dasharray: $len*0.35, $len;
    stroke-dashoffset: -$len*0.35;
  }

  100% {
    stroke-dasharray: $len*0.01, $len;
    stroke-dashoffset: -$len*0.99;
  }
}
....
```

as you can see the SCSS code is just copied not compiled. 

My expectaion would be for the CSS to be compiled to:

```
.outline-style {
  stroke-dasharray: 2.427766571px, 242.7766571045px;
  stroke-dashoffset: 0;
  -webkit-animation: anim 1.6s linear infinite;
          animation: anim 1.6s linear infinite;
}

@-webkit-keyframes anim {
  12.5% {
    stroke-dasharray: 33.9887319946px, 242.7766571045px;
    stroke-dashoffset: -26.7054322815px;
  }
  43.75% {
    stroke-dasharray: 84.9718299866px, 242.7766571045px;
    stroke-dashoffset: -84.9718299866px;
  }
  100% {
    stroke-dasharray: 2.427766571px, 242.7766571045px;
    stroke-dashoffset: -240.3488905334px;
  }
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SCSS not compiled correctly to CSS" (#10316)

Issues.Title: Add `delay-0` and `duration-0` by default
Issues.Body: Adds a `0s` value to the default `transitionDelay` and `transitionDuration` configurations. Useful as a conditional reset. Using `s` rather than `ms` because it‚Äôs shorter, which means a smaller CSS file and blazing fast performance.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add `delay-0` and `duration-0` by default" (#10294)

Issues.Title: Order of CSS selectors is not correct with v3.2.x in specific scenarios
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.2.4 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** I use Vite. But I was able to reproduce the bug with `npx tailwindcss -i ./src/style.css -o ./dist/style.css`. **What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.16.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Windows 10 **Reproduction URL** https://replit.com/@rahulv3a/Tailwind-bug. Please click on `Run` to run the instance and `Show files` to view the code. I couldn't replicate it on play.tailwindcss.com because the files are required to be in a specific folder structure to reproduce. **Describe your issue** I have a PHP project with hundreds of files. Markup of various components (like menus) is generated by a CMS. As adding classes is not an option, I need to use `[&_]` on the containers to style them. Some layouts break when I update from `v3.1.x` to `v3.2.x` because the CSS order of certain selectors in the CSS generated is wrong. It occurs only when: - `[&_]` classes are used with `v3.2.x`. Everything works flawlessly with `v3.1.x`. - specific conditions are met. I'm still trying to figure them out. But I was able to create an isolated demo for you. **Example** In the following markup, the list items should be stacked in SM, and side-by-side from MD onwards. But they stay stacked in all viewports. ```html
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
  • Item 3
``` Generated CSS: ```css @media (min-width: 768px) { .md\:\[\&_ul\]\:flex-row ul { flex-direction: row; } } .\[\&_ul\]\:flex ul { display: flex; } .\[\&_ul\]\:flex-col ul { flex-direction: column; } ``` Expected CSS: ```css .\[\&_ul\]\:flex ul { display: flex; } .\[\&_ul\]\:flex-col ul { flex-direction: column; } @media (min-width: 768px) { .md\:\[\&_ul\]\:flex-row ul { flex-direction: row; } } ``` **Demo** I created an online demo https://replit.com/@rahulv3a/Tailwind-bug of the example mentioned above. It contains only the code required to reproduce the bug. Please click on `Run` to run the instance and `Show files` to view the code. - Tailwind setup - v3.2.4 is being used. - `yarn tailwindcss -i ./src/style.css -o ./dist/style.css` is used to generate the CSS. - `preflight` is disabled to keep things simple. - Conditions - tailwind.config.js - `content` has `["./inc/**/*.php", "./templates/**/*.php"]`. - The order of the paths is important to replicate the issue. - inc/functions.php - It contains two comments. In my project, `./inc` contains hundreds of functions that are documented in detail. The comments contain words like contents, lowercase, etc. Tailwind creates classes for them which is fine. But for some reason unknown, the comments that start with `//` interfere with the order of CSS selectors. - template/01-required.php - I don't know why but this code is required to replicate the issue. - template/component.php - This file contains the actual code mentioned in the example above. **More examples** Here are some more examples of the bug I experience in my project with `v3.2.x`: - `
` stays hidden in all viewports. ```html

Lorem
Ipsum

``` - `` stays full width in all viewports. ```html ``` I can create isolated demos for each of them if it helps you debug. Please let me know if you need any other information.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Order of CSS selectors is not correct with v3.2.x in specific scenarios" (#10267)

Issues.Title: Consider earlier variants before sorting functions
Issues.Body:
We were sorting based on functions unconditionally before. This would result in problems with utilities using stacked variants where some of them used sorting functions. The output would end up entirely based on the result of the sorting functions instead of the order of the variants as a whole. We now effectively sort on a per-variant basis while still considering sort functions for variants that use them.

Fixes #10267
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Consider earlier variants before sorting functions" (#10288)

Issues.Title: Button custom bg color not working
Issues.Body:
Using 

tailwindcss v3.2.4
Nodejs16.17.0
Nextjs 10
Chrome browser
Windows OS

tailwind.config.js
`
theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        primary: {
          DEFAULT: '#073655',
          50: '#D9EEFC',
          100: '#B4DDF9',
          200: '#63B9F2',
          300: '#1897EC',
          400: '#0D65A0',
          500: '#073655',
          600: '#052A42',
          700: '#042134',
          800: '#031521',
          900: '#020C13',
        }
     }
  }
}   
`

Button code
`<button type="button" className="bg-primary">Button</button>`

The bg color on buttons is not working. It works everywhere else on divs, text, etc.

Any thoughts?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Button custom bg color not working" (#10282)

Issues.Title: Dynamic nested groups names webpack error
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

I'm using the latest v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

I'm using Next.js (v13.1.1) with Webpack (v5.74.0)

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.12.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

[CodeSandbox bug repoduction](https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/gifted-clarke-l6ite9?file=%2Fcomponents%2FContainer.tsx&selection=%5B%7B%22endColumn%22%3A1%2C%22endLineNumber%22%3A27%2C%22startColumn%22%3A1%2C%22startLineNumber%22%3A27%7D%5D)

**Describe your issue**

I tried to assign names to groups by props dynamically on runtime but it failed to compile with this message:

`./node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/css-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[1]!./node_modules/next/dist/build/webpack/loaders/postcss-loader/src/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[3].oneOf[11].use[2]!./styles/globals.css
TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading '5')
    at resolveMatches.next (<anonymous>)
    at Function.from (<anonymous>)
    at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)`

When i concatenate the `id` prop to a group with `+` operator this error don't come up but nested group doesn't work. I tried every plugin out there but nothing worked naming groups dynamically by props.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic nested groups names webpack error" (#10266)

Issues.Title: Escape group names in selectors
Issues.Body:
In v3.2.4 we would hard crash on the group variant `group/${id}`. This is because the name `${id}`:
1. Had `{` and `}` in it
2. These were unescaped
3. Even if manually escaped, we weren't handling this properly.

Here we fix this by doing two things:
1. Escaping the group / peer names so they can appear in a selector un-modified.
2. Handling escaped characters properly in a variant format string

Fixes #10266
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Escape group names in selectors" (#10276)

Issues.Title: Next init/install needs to be updated
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 13.1.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.17.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS 

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/hyperknot/next-tailwind-bug

In repo, run build, go to .next/static/css, run prettier and and look at the first line. It shows `width <= 50rem` which means the preset-env plugin is not applied.

**Describe your issue**

The simplified config (`tailwindcss` + `autoprefixer`) is not enough. We need to include a full config, like this. It also means we need to install `postcss-flexbugs-fixes` and `postcss-preset-env` in addition.

```
module.exports = {
  plugins: [
    'tailwindcss',
    'autoprefixer',
    'postcss-flexbugs-fixes',
    [
      'postcss-preset-env',
      {
        autoprefixer: {
          flexbox: 'no-2009',
        },
        stage: 3,
        features: {
          'custom-properties': false,
        },
      },
    ],
  ],
}
```

I've opened in issue in Next for this:
https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/44286
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Next init/install needs to be updated" (#10275)

Issues.Title: Npx tailwindcss does not have option to output whole tailwindcss
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
...
"postcss": 8.4.20,
"autoprefixer": 10.4.13
"tailwindcss": "3.2.4"
"tailwindcss-cli": "0.1.2"
...
**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.19.0

**What browser are you using?**

I'm testing it on Vscode terminal

**What operating system are you using?**

Linux Mint 20.3 Cinnamon@5.2.7

**Reproduction URL**

I'm gonna explain how you can reproduce below.

**Describe your issue**

`npx tailwindcss -i tailwind.css  -o output.css` can only create base styles with tailwindcss v.3.2.4. When I add some content to tailwind.config.js it still does not create what I wanted. There should be an option for that command to output whole tailwindcss into a file.

The other command that I tried with `tailwindcss-cli` can create whole code but with tailwindcss v2 and there seems there is no option to choose version.

`npx tailwindcss-cli build ./tailwind.css -o ./output.css`

Is there any way to output whole v3.2.4 or the current version with tailwindcss cli or postcss plugins? The latter would be more useful.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Npx tailwindcss does not have option to output whole tailwindcss" (#10259)

Issues.Title: Multiple definitions of the transition-property
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v3.2.4 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** - tailwindcss cli (Standalone command) - Tailwind Play **What version of Node.js are you using?** For example: v14.18.1 (tailwindcss cli) **What browser are you using?** For example: Chrome 108.0.5359.124 **What operating system are you using?** For example: Ubuntu 20.04 **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/NR9bHuVry6 **Describe your issue** Multiple definitions of the transition-property in [Transition Property](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/transition-property). ### Current generated properties - transition ```css transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, fill, stroke, opacity, box-shadow, transform, filter, -webkit-text-decoration-color, -webkit-backdrop-filter; transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, text-decoration-color, fill, stroke, opacity, box-shadow, transform, filter, backdrop-filter; transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, text-decoration-color, fill, stroke, opacity, box-shadow, transform, filter, backdrop-filter, -webkit-text-decoration-color, -webkit-backdrop-filter; transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); transition-duration: 150ms; ``` - transition-colors ```css transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, fill, stroke, -webkit-text-decoration-color; transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, text-decoration-color, fill, stroke; transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, text-decoration-color, fill, stroke, -webkit-text-decoration-color; transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); transition-duration: 150ms; ``` ### Document - transition ```css transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, text-decoration-color, fill, stroke, opacity, box-shadow, transform, filter, backdrop-filter; transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); transition-duration: 150ms; ``` - transition-colors ```css transition-property: color, background-color, border-color, text-decoration-color, fill, stroke; transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); transition-duration: 150ms; ``` ### Chrome developer tool Property has been overwritten and is not functional.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Multiple definitions of the transition-property" (#10257)
